result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

State asks that counts 1 and 3, and 2 and 4 be transactionally related. Defense agrees that those counts are related, but not to each other.  Court finds counts 1 and 3, 2 and 4 are transactionally related.  State calls Det. K. Meyer, City of Madison, sworn. Direct. Witness identifies defendant. Cross. Witness excused.  State moves for bind over.  Defense objects, waives argument.  CT. finds probable cause and does bind over.
Preliminary hearing on August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Setover request for preliminary hearing 8/9/22
Preliminary hearing on August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:11 AM Court reporter Rowan Thompson. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Shaun O'Connell.  Annie Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests set over and defendant waives time limits. State does not object. Court will set over.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Laura Breun
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)
Preliminary hearing on July 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,500 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 12

02:20 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
